side.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: one of the two areas that are on the left or the right of an imaginary line, or on the left or the right of a border, wall, river etc
side.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: A man stood watching me from the other side of the road.
His friends and family were all on the other side of the world.
The restaurant was empty apart from another couple on the far side of the room  (=the area that is furthest away from you).
In Sri Lanka they drive on the left-hand side of the road.
The south side of town is pretty run down.
a scar on the right side of his face
Fuel is cheaper on the French side of the border.
She tilted her head to one side, pretending to consider the question.
side.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a position directly next to someone or something, on the right or the left
side.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Stand on this side of me so Dad can get a photo.
A little girl was skipping along at her side.
at somebody’s side/at the side of something
There was a card tacked to the wall at the side of the photograph.
at somebody’s side/at the side of something
Two large screens stood on either side of the stage  (=one on the left and one on the right side of it).
side.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a surface of something that is not its front, back, top, or bottom
side.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: He led the way round to the side of the building.
Someone ran into the side of my car.
side.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the part of an object or area that is furthest from the middle, at or near the edge
side.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Jack sat down heavily on the side of the bed.
She pulled into the side of the road and stopped the car.
side.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: one of the two surfaces of a thin flat object
side.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Write on only one side of the paper.
I’ll paint the other side of the fence tomorrow.
There’s a scratch on one side of the record.
side.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: the part of your body from the top of your arm to the top of your leg
side.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: He had a scar running right the way down his side.
Betty was lying on her side on the bed.
side.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: one of the flat surfaces or edges of a shape
side.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: one of the sloping areas of a hill, mountain etc
side.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: sheep grazing on the steep hillside
Their house was on the side of the valley.
side.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: a page of writing on one side of a piece of paper
side.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: How many sides have we got to write?
side.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: one part or feature of something, especially when compared with another part
side.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: Look on the bright side (=see the good side of a situation) – at least you learned something from the experience.
It’s a children’s book about fairies and magic, but it does have a dark side.
She takes care of the financial side of the business.
Can’t you see the funny side of all this?
Environmental pollution gives great cause for concern, but, on the positive side, people are beginning to try and find solutions.
side.translation[0].definitions[10].defi: one of the people, groups, or countries opposing each other in a quarrel, war etc
side.translation[0].definitions[10].note: whose side are you on? spoken (=used when someone is arguing against you when they should be supporting you)
side.translation[0].definitions[10].exam: He fought on the Republican side in the Spanish Civil War.
a peace deal that is acceptable to both sides
During the war, he changed sides several times.
He always likes to be on the winning side.
Well, at least someone’s on my side.
side.translation[0].definitions[11].defi: one person’s opinion or attitude in an argument or disagreement
side.translation[0].definitions[11].exam: Try and see my side of things for a change!
Well, I can see both sides. They both have a point.
We haven’t heard Mike’s side of the story yet.
side.translation[0].definitions[12].exam: They’re a good side, but I think we’re a better one.
side.translation[0].definitions[13].defi: one part of someone’s character, especially when compared with another part
side.translation[0].definitions[13].exam: There was a side to him that worried her, that seemed cold and cruel.
These days men are not all afraid to show their softer side.
It was a side of Shari that I hadn’t seen before.
side.translation[0].definitions[14].exam: My father’s side of the family are short, but my mother’s side are tall.
side.translation[0].definitions[15].defi: a small amount of food that you order in a restaurant in addition to your main meal
side.translation[0].definitions[15].exam: a hamburger with a side of fries
side.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: one of the two areas that are on the left or the right of an imaginary line, or on the left or the right of a border, wall, river etc
side.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: A path leads down one side of the garden to a paved area.
On the other side of the river are some low hills.
There were tall hedges on either side of the lawn.
Nicolo was standing on the far side of the room.
He received a deep cut on the right side of his face.
On the left-hand side list the skills and qualifications required for the job.
The shop was on the west side of Culver Street.
side.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 12: one part or feature of something, especially when compared with another part
side.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: Geller handles the business side of things.
Gregory works on the technical side, liaising with the sound and lighting people.
The social side of the group is very important.
Luckily, when I explained the situation, he saw the funny side of it.
On the positive side, the authors have assembled a wealth of useful material.
It was her nature to look on the bright side.
The book is an examination of the dark side of genius.
The art program is meant to bring out children’s creative side.
side.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: in or on the side of something
side.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Hannah slipped out through a side exit.
side.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Can you get a side view?
side.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to support or argue against a person or group in a quarrel, fight etc
side.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Frank sided with David against their mother.
